tit.e: Gobomaki (rolled dish with a burdock root)
tit.cmt: ※「ごぼう巻き」の訳は用語集から採用しています。
tit.e: Gobomaki (rolled dish with a burdock root)
Gobomaki (rolled dish with a burdock root)

sen.j: ごぼう巻き（ごぼうまき）は、ゴボウを使った料理の一つ。
sen.e: Gobomaki is a dish using burdock root.
Gobomaki is a dish using gobo (burdock root).
Gobomaki is a dish using gobo (burdock root).

sen.j: 様々な形態で調理されるものを指す。
sen.e: It may be cooked in a wide variety of ways.
It may be cooked in a wide variety of ways.
It may be cooked in a wide variety of ways.

tit.e: Nikumaki (meat roll with a burdock root)
tit.cmt: ※「肉巻き」の訳は用語集から採用しています。
tit.e: Nikumaki (meat roll with a burdock root)
Nikumaki (meat roll with a burdock root)

sen.j: 薄切りの肉（牛肉・豚肉など）で下ゆでしたゴボウを巻き、フライパン等で焼き付け、醤油・砂糖などの調味料を加えて煮絡めたもの。
sen.e: It is a dish in which gobo (burdock root), boiled beforehand, is wrapped with thinly sliced meat such as beef and pork, broiled in a frying pan, dressed with seasonings like soy sauce, sugar, etc.
It is a dish in which burdock root, boiled beforehand, is wrapped with thinly sliced meat such as beef and pork, broiled in a frying pan, dressed with seasonings like soy sauce, sugar, and so on.
It is a dish in which burdock root, boiled beforehand, is wrapped with thinly sliced meat such as beef and pork, broiled in a frying pan, dressed with seasonings like soy sauce, sugar, and so on.

sen.j: 近年ではゴボウの煮染めの代わりとして御節料理の一つとして作られることが多い。
sen.e: It has often been made as an osechi food (special dish prepared for the New Year) in place of nishime of gobo (gobo cooked almost to dryness in soy sauce and water) in recent years.
sen.cmt: ※「ゴボウの煮染め」と「御節料理」の訳は用語集の訳をもとに作成しています。
sen.e: It has often been made as an osechi food (special dish prepared for the New Year) in place of gobo no nishime (burdock root cooked almost to dryness in soy sauce and water) in recent years.
It has often been made as an osechi food (special dish prepared for the New Year) in place of gobo no nishime (burdock root cooked almost to dryness in soy sauce and water) in recent years.

sen.j: 弁当のおかずなどでも見られる。
sen.e: It is also used as a side dish for a boxed lunch.
It is also used as a side dish for a boxed lunch.
It is also used as a side dish for a boxed lunch.

sen.j: 魚肉練り製品の一つとして、ゴボウを魚のすり身で包み、油で揚げたものを指すことがある。
sen.e: As a boiled fish-paste product, it may refer to gobo that is wrapped in minced fish and is fried in oil.
sen.cmt: ※「魚肉練り製品」の訳は用語集から採用しています。
sen.e: As a boiled fish-paste product, it may refer to burdock root that is wrapped in minced fish and is fried in oil.
As a boiled fish-paste product, it may refer to burdock root that is wrapped in minced fish and is fried in oil.

sen.j: いわゆる薩摩揚げの一種で、「ゴボウ天（ゴボ天）」（ゴボウの天ぷらの意）と呼ばれることも少なくない。
sen.e: It is a type of Satsuma-age (fried fish cake), often called 'goboten,' meaning tempura (Japanese deep-fried dish) of gobo.
sen.cmt: ※「薩摩揚げ」と「天ぷら」の訳は用語集から採用しています。
sen.e: It is a type of Satsuma-age (fried fish cake), often called 'goboten,' meaning tenpura (Japanese deep-fried dish) of burdock root.
sen.cmt: 半角クォーテーションにし、用語を変えました。
sen.e: It is a type of Satsuma-age (fried fish cake), often called 'goboten,' meaning tenpura (Japanese deep-fried dish) of burdock root.

sen.j: おでんの具材として用いられることが多い。
sen.e: It is often used as an ingredient for oden (a Japanese dish containing all kinds of ingredients cooked in a special broth of soy sauce, sugar, sake, etc.).
sen.cmt: ※「おでん」の訳は用語集から採用しています。
sen.e: It is often used as an ingredient for oden (a Japanese dish containing all kinds of ingredients cooked in a special broth of soy sauce, sugar, sake, and so on).
It is often used as an ingredient for oden (a Japanese dish containing all kinds of ingredients cooked in a special broth of soy sauce, sugar, sake, and so on).

sen.j: 蒲鉾の材料になる魚（エソ・グチ等）の魚皮を用いて作られるものがある。
sen.e: Some are made with fish such as eso (lizardfish) and guchi (white croaker) which are made into kamaboko (boiled fish paste).
sen.cmt: ※「蒲鉾」「エソ」「グチ」の訳は用語集から採用しています。
sen.e: Some are made with fish such as eso (lizardfish) and guchi (white croaker) which are made into kamaboko (boiled fish paste).
Some are made with fish such as eso (lizardfish) and guchi (white croaker) which are made into kamaboko (boiled fish paste).

sen.j: 三枚におろし、身を除いた魚の皮をたれに漬け込み、ゴボウの周囲に巻き付け（皮を巻く前にすり身を巻き付ける場合もあり）、照り焼きにしたものである。
sen.e: It is served in teriyaki style in which fish is cut into fillets and its skin, without the meat, is dipped in tare (sauce made with soy sauce, sake, and other seasonings) and wrapped around a gobo, sometimes with its minced fish wrapped under the skin.
sen.cmt: ※「たれ」の訳は用語集から採用しています。
sen.e: It is served in teriyaki style in which fish is cut into fillets and its skin, without the meat, is dipped in tare (sauce made with soy sauce, sake, and other seasonings) and wrapped around a piece of burdock root, sometimes with its minced fish wrapped under the skin.

It is served in teriyaki style in which fish is cut into fillets and its skin, without the meat, is dipped in tare (sauce made with soy sauce, sake, and other seasonings) and wrapped around a piece of burdock root, sometimes with its minced fish wrapped under the skin.

sen.j: 元々は蒲鉾の副産物の再利用から生まれたものであるが、蒲鉾の原材料に冷凍すり身を使うことも増えてきた現在では珍味として重宝されることも多い。
sen.e: Originally born out of a reused by-product of kamaboko, it is now often appreciated as a delicacy, as kamaboko has been increasingly made from frozen minced fish.
Originally born out of a reused by-product of kamaboko, it is now often appreciated as a delicacy, as kamaboko has been increasingly made from frozen minced fish.
Originally born out of a reused by-product of kamaboko, it is now often appreciated as a delicacy, as kamaboko has been increasingly made from frozen minced fish.

sen.j: 和歌山県和歌山県紀南/南紀（田辺市等）と山口県長北地区（萩市等）のものが知られている。
sen.e: It is famously produced in Kinan or Nanki, Wakayama Prefecture including Tanabe City and Chohoku Area, Yamaguchi Prefecture including Hagi City.
It is famously produced in Kinan or Nanki, Wakayama Prefecture including Tanabe City and Chohoku region, Yamaguchi Prefecture including Hagi City.
It is famously produced in Kinan or Nanki, Wakayama Prefecture including Tanabe City and Chohoku region, Yamaguchi Prefecture including Hagi City.

sen.j: いずれも当地ではおせち料理の定番となっている。
sen.e: It has become a stable in osechi in both of these areas.
It has become a stable in osechi in both of these regions.
It has become a stable in osechi in both of these regions.

sen.j: また、ウナギでゴボウを巻いた物もあり、稀にこれが「う巻き」（本来はウナギの蒲焼を巻き込んだ卵焼き）と称されることもある。
sen.e: There is also gobo wrapped in unagi (eel), which is rarely called 'umaki,' though umaki originally referred to a rolled omelet with broiled unagi as a core.
sen.cmt: ※「う巻き」の説明は用語集の訳をもとに作成しています。
sen.e: There is also gobo wrapped in unagi (eel), which is rarely called 'umaki,' though umaki originally referred to a rolled omelet with broiled unagi as a core.
sen.cmt: 半角クォーテーションにしました。
sen.e: There is also gobo wrapped in unagi (eel), which is rarely called 'umaki,' though umaki originally referred to a rolled omelet with broiled unagi as a core.
